name: Parque Bolivar
address: Calle Bolívar between O'Connor and Av. La Paz, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Parque Bolivar is a public park in the heart of Tarija, Bolivia. It is a favorite spot for locals and visitors, featuring beautiful gardens, walking paths, and monuments that highlight Bolivia's cultural heritage.

name: Castillo Azul
address: Calle Bolívar E-644 between Junín and O'Connor, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Castillo Azul is a historic building designed in Art Nouveau style by Swiss-Italian architects. Once a country house for the Navajas family, it is admired for its iconic blue facade and intricate architecture.

name: Plaza Sucre
address: Calle 15 de Abril between Calle Colón and Calle Suipacha, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Plaza Sucre is a cozy square surrounded by gardens, cafes, and restaurants. It is a peaceful place to relax and soak in the lively atmosphere of Tarija.

name: Parque de las Flores
address: La Loma Neighborhood, between Cochabamba Street and Aniceto Arce, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Parque de las Flores is renowned for its blooming flowers and greenery, offering a serene escape for nature enthusiasts and those seeking tranquility.

name: Plaza Luis de Fuentes
description: Plaza Luis de Fuentes, the main square of Tarija, is a bustling hub with a fountain, statues, and landscaped gardens, making it an iconic meeting point in the city.

name: Represa de San Jacinto
description: Represa de San Jacinto is a reservoir perfect for outdoor activities like fishing and boating. The scenic views of the surrounding landscape make it a popular getaway.

name: Iglesia de San Roque
address: General Trigo Street corner Fray Manuel Mingo, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Iglesia de San Roque is a colonial church dedicated to Saint Roch, notable for its historical architecture and central role in the annual Fiesta de San Roque.

name: Casa Dorada
address: General Bernardo Trigo Street, Tarija, Bolivia
description: Casa Dorada is an emblematic cultural site featuring modernist design and housing a gallery, library, and theater. It stands as a national monument of Bolivia.
